alert.note: Alert for Forrest (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 7:01PM CST until February 05 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Black Creek Near Brooklyn affecting Forrest County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black Creek Near Brooklyn. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Widespread flooding of lowland approximately 5 miles up and downstream of the gage site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.5 feet near midnight then fall below flood stage Saturday morning before noon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Black Creek Brooklyn 20.0 20.3 Fri 5 pm CST 18.7 14.3 10.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued early tomorrow morning by 9AM CST.
